DataElement.preferredName: Cervical Neoplasm Pathologic Margin Involved Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Free-text field to capture another type of cervical cancer margin involvement that is not already specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.:Margin; the boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
A boundary line or the area immediately inside the boundary.

Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
